p: The Southern Oscillation Index (SOI) is used to measure the intensity of El Niño and La Niña events, which strongly affect changes in temperature and precipitation [ 42, 43]. Thus, we used the global climatic factor of SOI to explore the potential impact of ENSO events on the dynamics of imported CHIKV cases in Australia. The monthly SOI is available from the Australian Government Bureau of Meteorology website ( www.bom.gov.au/climate/current/soihtm1.shtml).
